bibl.title: Taichi Hiura v. Henry M. White. Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Petition of Hiura, Teiichi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus.
In the Matter of the Petition of Hiura, Teiichi for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

In this cause the court having heretofore on the 14th day of August, 1920, granted an order requiring the Honorable Henry M.White, United States Immigration Commissioner at the Port of Seattle, to show cause before this court on the 1st day of September, 1920, at the hour of 10:00 o'clock A.M. why a Writ of Habeas Corpus should not be issued in accordance with the petition of the petitioner, Hiura, Teiichi, theretofore filed herein on said 14th day of August, 1920, and the matter having been continued by order of the court from September 1st, 1920 at the hour of 10:00 o'clock A.M. to September 3rd, 1920, at the hour of 10:00 o'clock A.M.; and on said 3rd day of September, 1920, at the hour of 10:00 o'clock A.M. the matter having come on for hearing upon the return made by said United States Immigration Commissioner in accordance with said order heretofore filed, and upon the oral demurrer of the petitioner to said return; the court having heard the matter upon the argument of James Kiefer, attorney for said petitioner, and the argument of the United States Attorney representing the said United States Immigration Commissioner, and being fully advised in the premises;
It is by the court ORDERED and CONSIDERED, and the court does hereby ORDER and CONSIDER, that a Writ of Habeas Corpus do issue herein returnable forthwith commanding the said United

States Immigration Commissioner at the Port of Seattle to produce before the above entitled court the body of Hiura, Teiichi, petitioner herein, then and there to submit to and receive whatever the court shall order in the premises.
Done in Open Court this 4th day of September,1920.
